pr_title: NMS-12850: removed references to old remote poller from documentation

timeline.message: NMS-12850: Remove references to the old remote poller
NMS-12850: Remove references to the old remote poller

timeline.bodyText: I think the term deprecated is misleading when talking about the remote poller. We still have one (better than ever)
timeline.author: fooker
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -22,7 +22,7 @@ ADDITIONAL_MANAGER_OPTIONS="$ADDITIONAL_MANAGER_OPTIONS -Dopennms.poller.server.
 ADDITIONAL_MANAGER_OPTIONS="$ADDITIONAL_MANAGER_OPTIONS -Djava.rmi.server.hostname=<your-server-ip-address>"
 ----
 
-This tells {opennms-product-name} to listen for RMI on port `18980`, and to listen on all interfaces.  (Originally, RMI was only used for the Remote Poller, so despite the porperty name mentioning the "opennms poller server" it applies to RMI as a whole.)  Note that you _must_ include the `-Djava.rmi.server.hostname=` option or {opennms-product-name} will accept connections on the RMI port, but not be able to complete a valid connection.
+This tells {opennms-product-name} to listen for RMI on port `18980`, and to listen on all interfaces. (Originally, RMI was only used for the deprecated Remote Poller, so despite the property name mentioning the "opennms poller server" it applies to RMI as a whole.)  Note that you _must_ include the `-Djava.rmi.server.hostname=` option or {opennms-product-name} will accept connections on the RMI port, but not be able to complete a valid connection.
